availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Barbour (Caldwell County, Kentucky, attorney, one of counsel for Thos Wadlington)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, attorney. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Married to Susan E. Barbour. Father of William G. Barbour, Kit Barbour, Sarah C. Barbour, Edgar P. Barbour, Laura M. Barbour, and Oscar L. Barbour. Attorney in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Attorney in Princeton in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 281A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 1-2 of 18 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 110.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 218A.
